description: (In-game) Base chance per round that an eligible faction will be selected for aggression increase. Base Chance + (Rounds Played * Per Round Chance). The Aggression rank mechanic is mostly depractated, its sole remaining purpose is a small impact on strategic stance, but even this is mostly disabled through data

(In-game) Additional per round chance that an eligible faction will be selected for aggression increase. Base Chance + (Rounds Played * Per Round Chance). The Aggression rank mechanic is mostly depractated, its sole remaining purpose is a small impact on strategic stance, but even this is mostly disabled through data

(In-game) Whether the aggression ramp is enable. 0=no, 1=yes. The Aggression rank mechanic is mostly depractated, its sole remaining purpose is a small impact on strategic stance, but even this is mostly disabled through data

(In-game) Player fame level at which the ramp ends and the maximum level of aggression will be applied. The Aggression rank mechanic is mostly depractated, its sole remaining purpose is a small impact on strategic stance, but even this is mostly disabled through data

(In-game) Player fame level beyond which the aggression ramp will start to apply. The Aggression rank mechanic is mostly depractated, its sole remaining purpose is a small impact on strategic stance, but even this is mostly disabled through data

(In-game) The ending level for the aggression ramp to use. 1-6. Should be equal to or greater than the minimum level selected. 1=LOW, 2=LOW_TO_MEDIUM, 3=MEDIUM, 4=MEDIUM_TO_HIGH, 5=HIGH, 6=VERY HIGH. The Aggression rank mechanic is mostly depractated, its sole remaining purpose is a small impact on strategic context, but even this is mostly disabled through data

(In-game) The starting level for the aggression ramp to use. 1-6. 1=LOW, 2=LOW_TO_MEDIUM, 3=MEDIUM, 4=MEDIUM_TO_HIGH, 5=HIGH, 6=VERY HIGH. The Aggression rank mechanic is mostly depractated, its sole remaining purpose is a small impact on strategic stance, but even this is mostly disabled through data

(In-game) Round at which the ramp should finish (and max level be used for aggression increases). The Aggression rank mechanic is mostly depractated, its sole remaining purpose is a small impact on strategic stance, but even this is mostly disabled through data

(In-game) Round beyond which the aggression ramp will start (beginning with the minimum aggression level). The Aggression rank mechanic is mostly depractated, its sole remaining purpose is a small impact on strategic stance, but even this is mostly disabled through data
(In-game) Used for the CAI to determine how long to avoid ambush locations.
(In-game) Used for the CA armory item scoring: this is the base score for any unremarkable item.
(In-game) Used for the CA armory item scoring: this is the score an item will have if it's god-specific.
(In-game) Used for the CA armory item scoring: this is the score an item will have if it belongs to an item set.
(In-game) If faction has not gained any region for this many rounds, attack tasks for all settlements is generated.

(In-game) The priority of the attack if havent expanded task goes to maximum if we havent captured territory for CAI_VARIABLE_ATTACK_ALL_ENEMY_SETTLEMENTS_IF_FACTION_HASNT_EXPANDED_FOR_ROUNDS+CAI_VARIABLE_ATTACK_ALL_ENEMY_SETTLEMENTS_IF_FACTION_HASNT_EXPANDED_MAX_PRIORITY_IN_ROUNDS
(In-game) In generating tasks versus human horde armies the starting priority used.
(In-game) In generating tasks versus human horde armies the round at which to start applying a priority variation.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, lower distance bound.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, lower distance priority multiplier.
(In-game) In generating tasks versus human horde armies the ending priority used.
(In-game) In generating tasks versus human horde armies the round at which to end applying a priority variation.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, upper distance bound.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, upper distance priority multiplier.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack non-human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, lower distance bound.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack non- human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, lower distance priority multiplier.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack non-human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, upper distance bound.
(In-game) Multiplier applied to attack non-human horde armies tasks based on distance to nearest asset, upper distance priority multiplier.
(In-game) AIs won't exceed this percent of the current supply of a particular resource when proposing single barters for that resource.
(In-game) Bonus applied to scoring of cultural conversion options in the construction system.
(In-game) Bonus applied to scoring of demolition options in the construction system.
(In-game) Bonus applied to scoring of repair options in the construction system.
(In-game) Strenght bonus from black ark support

(In-game) Multiplier applied to region count values if climate change mitigation is in effect (CAI_VARIABLE_FOOD_CTRL_BUILDING_APPLY_BONUS_AT_OR_BELOW_REGION_ADJUSTMENT, CAI_VARIABLE_FOOD_CTRL_BUILDING_APPLY_PENALTY_BELOW_REGION_ADJUSTMENT).
(In-game) Rounds from expected climate change that AI's will start to take mitigating action.
(In-game) When considering the importance of buildings for a specific context how much should value for money count versus raw priority (0.0, not a bit to 1.0, entirely).

(In-game) Enables CAI faction controller management.
(In-game) For valid factions the base faction management probability.

(In-game) Should minor factions be considered for minimisation.
(In-game) For faction management, the lower threshold below which it will automatically be enabled if possible.

(In-game) The point at or below which bonus will be provided to food producgin buildings.
(In-game) Adjustment to the food penalty thresholds based on number of regions owned by a faction.
(In-game) The point below which a food penalty will be applied to a building option.
(In-game) Adjustment to the food penalty thresholds based on number of regions owned by a faction.
(In-game) Bonus applied (per food point) for buildings that increase food up to the specified level.
(In-game) When calculating food based building score adjustements, the discount applied for being a new building.
(In-game) Penalty applied (per food point) for buildings that use food beyond the specified level.
(In-game) Score at or above which the ongoing food detection system will start allowing building conversion to solve the problem.
(In-game) Per region based adjustment to CAI_VARIABLE_FOOD_CTRL_ONGOING_PROBLEM_CONVERSION_THRESHOLD_BASIC.
(In-game) Score at or above which the ongoing food detection system will start allowing building demolition to solve the problem.
(In-game) Per region based adjustment to CAI_VARIABLE_FOOD_CTRL_ONGOING_PROBLEM_DEMOLITION_THRESHOLD_BASIC.
(In-game) When accruing score for the ongoing food problem detection system the cap applied to the amount being added to the score.
(In-game) Base probability for demoliting discovered foreign slots.
(In-game) Discoverability cap level for helping determine if the AI should demolished discovered foreign slots.
(In-game) Cap adjusted discoverability multiplier for converting that value in to a demolition chance percentage for knocking down discovered foreign slots.
(In-game) AI strength bonus for fortified settlements.
(In-game) AI strength multiplier for fortified settlements, modified by Siege engines.
(In-game) AI strength multiplier for fortified settlements, pre-assault.
(In-game) Reduction of fortification bonus for each siege engine present.
(In-game) AI strength multiplier for fortified settlements used for threat detection.
(In-game) Modifier for enemy strength in threat calculations. Cannot be 0.
(In-game) Used to limit the frequency of ultimatums issued by AIs to human players.
(In-game) When adding a horde to an existing group the number of hordes to split from the group (excluding the new horde) to use in forming a new horde group.
(In-game) Maximum size of a horde group.
(In-game) Maximum acceptable distance from a horde to consider membership - multiplier on the median bordering inter-region distance.
(In-game) Modifier to imperium attitude bonus towards the AI. Global multiplier to cai_personality_empire_rivalry_components
(In-game) Modifier to imperium attitude bonus towards the player. Global multiplier to cai_personality_empire_rivalry_components
(In-game) Modifier to imperium attitude penalty towards the AI. Global multiplier to cai_personality_empire_rivalry_components
(In-game) Modifier to imperium attitude penalty towards the player. Global multiplier to cai_personality_empire_rivalry_components

(In-game) If the vortex ritual we're interrupting is lower than this level, we weight the different intervention ritual levels based on the INVERSE of their casting cost (so low level intervention will have higher chance). Note: ritual index starts from 0, so if it's set to 2 it means we'll use inverted weights at vortex ritual level 1 and 2. THE END
(In-game) An absolute monetary value; specifies the maximum allowed difference between the actual minimum payment required to make a deal acceptable and the one proposed by Make this Work.
(In-game) AI will receive a bonus to confederating when the resulting faction would be under this proportion of human strength.
(In-game) Maximum number of goals evaluated by all factions per round.
(In-game) Maximum number of non crucial offers a human player can receive per round.
(In-game) Number of siege engines required before rebels assault a highest level fortified settlement.
(In-game) Probability of migration at the lower threshold.
(In-game) Probability of migration at and beyond the upper threshold.
(In-game) Lower threshold for enemy strength for migration. Expressed as a multiple of our strength.
(In-game) Upper threshold for enemy strength for migration. Expressed as a multiple of our strength.
(In-game) Hordes below that attitude will be considered a threat when deciding whether to migrate.
(In-game) Minimum wait of rounds before AIs can make non crucial offers to a human player after the campaign start.
(In-game) Percentage chance that the AI will choose to fight you on the field for non-port, minor settlement battles. DOES NOTHING IN WH3
(In-game) Smallest AP cost for a traversible non-settlement land hex. Used to get a worst-(i.e largest-)case bounds for the region a mobile could move to.
(In-game) Number of siege engines required before rebels assault a lowest level fortified settlement.
(In-game) Weight of army strength when analyzing strength on sea.
(In-game) Weight of navy strength when analyzing strength on sea.
(In-game) Percentage chance that the AI will choose to fight you at night.
(In-game) Time in rounds beyond which specific occupation decisions information against a settlement will be forgotten.
(In-game) Used to determine what the CAI consideres a high level of ogre meat at an army
(In-game) Used to determine what the CAI consideres a moderate level of ogre meat at an army

(In-game) If the Ogre AI's alliance's strength ratio to the enemy alliance equals this value (or higher), the AI uses the lowest level Meat effect. I.e. if I'm strong, I'm use the weakest Meat level (if I can afford it).

(In-game) If the Ogre AI's alliance's strength ratio to the enemy alliance equals this value (or lower), the AI uses the highest level Meat effect. I.e. if I'm weak, I'll use the strongest Meat level. This is independent of cost, so if this ratio allows a meat level that the army cannot afford, then we'll use the highest that we can afford instead.
(In-game) On the prebattle screen, the percentage change that the Ogre AI will use meat at strength ratio of cai_variable_ogre_meat_prebattle_usage_chance_strength_ratio_max or higher

(In-game) On the prebattle screen, the percentage change that the Ogre AI will use meat in battles that are specifically against the player at strength ratio of cai_variable_ogre_meat_prebattle_usage_chance_strength_ratio_max or higher
(In-game) On the prebattle screen, the percentage change that the Ogre AI will use meat at strength ratio of cai_variable_ogre_meat_prebattle_usage_chance_strength_ratio_min or lower

(In-game) On the prebattle screen, the percentage change that the Ogre AI will use meat in battles that are specifically against the player at strength ratio of cai_variable_ogre_meat_prebattle_usage_chance_strength_ratio_min or lower

(In-game) On the prebattle screen, if the Ogre AI's alliance's strength ratio to the enemy alliance equals this value (or higher), we'll use the cai_variable_ogre_meat_prebattle_usage_chance_at_max_ratio chance (or the player variant) when we do a random roll on using this feature.

(In-game) On the prebattle screen, if the Ogre AI's alliance's strength ratio to the enemy alliance equals this value (or lower), we'll use the cai_variable_ogre_meat_prebattle_usage_chance_at_min_ratio chance (or the player variant) when we do a random roll on using this feature.
(In-game) Upper bound for player AP deadzone adjustment for threat detection purposes.
(In-game) Lower bound for player AP deadzone adjustment for threat detection purposes. The AI will not consider the players movement range to be within the range of this and ...DEADZONE_MAX
(In-game) Upper bound for player AP adjustment for threat detection purposes.

(In-game) Lower bound for player AP adjustment for threat detection purposes. The AI will scale the players movement range by a random value between this and ...ADJUSTMENT_MAX when calculating its movement.
(In-game) The point at or below which bonus will be provided to public order improvement buildings.
(In-game) The point below which a public order penalty will be applied to a building option.
(In-game) Bonus applied (per public order point) for buildings that increae public order up to the specified level.
(In-game) When calculating public order based building score adjustements, the discount applied for being a new building.
(In-game) Penalty applied (per public order point) for buildings that use public order beyond the specified level.
(In-game) The public order problem score for a province beyond which conversion is considered as a solution.
(In-game) The public order problem score for a province beyond which demolition is considered as a solution.
(In-game) The maximum public order problem score that can be accumulated in one round for a given province.
(In-game) Limits the rebel unit quality to (([sum of building levels in region] * multiplier) + offset) * [quality of best recruitable unit in faction province].
(In-game) Limits the rebel unit quality to (([sum of building levels in region] * multiplier) + offset) * [quality of best recruitable unit in faction province].
(In-game) In the case that an additional rebellion would trigger in a region with an existing rebellion, by how much should that existing rebellions attack time out be adjusted. Maximum adjustment.
(In-game) In the case that an additional rebellion would trigger in a region with an existing rebellion, by how much should that existing rebellions attack time out be adjusted. Minimum adjustment.
(In-game) Maximum timeout used for a rebel faction before it should consider an arbitrary attack.
(In-game) Minimum timeout used for a rebel faction before it should consider an arbitrary attack.
(In-game) Penalty for giving away regions from provinces owned entirely by us.
(In-game) Used to multiply the building evaluation given by the construction system behaviour desire.
(In-game) Bonus for obtaining regions which complete our partially owned provinces.
(In-game) Multiplied by the number of resources we would gain by obtaining the region.
(In-game) Penalty for obtaining regions with bad public order.
(In-game) Bonus for obtaining a region for which this faction has a region hint for a victory condition.
(In-game) Penalty for giving away regions with stable public order.
(In-game) Penalty for giving away a region for which this faction has a region hint for a victory condition.
(In-game) Multiplied by the number of resources we would lose by giving the region away.
(In-game) Multiplied by the sum of the tiers of the unit types we would lose by giving the region away.
(In-game) Bonus for obtaining regions in provinces partially owned by us.
(In-game) Penalty for giving away recently acquired regions of ours.
